title: How I imagine CertainlyT after reading Origens: Azir

replies.body: That's exactly how I remember it.
This actually explains everything about Brad that I missed out on.

Question; and if you can't answer it, It's be lovely if you could direct the correct person to answer it.

If the sand/water particles were too much to look good because of the ampunt of particles necessary, why can't you do it elementalist Lux style with packaging the particles and opening them up everytime an ability is cast?
Imagine Lux's E, across your whole screen, and in FoW, that is a ton of memory to handle for just one champion.

Pretty sure that tech was developed for Lux's ultimate skin, and therefore didn't exist at the time of Azir's development.

Additionally, I believe the tech (and I might completely misunderstand) allows the particles to be recolored and adjusted, so the E particles are all based off the same particle, but adjusted in a way that makes all 10 flavors look different.

My reading on the sand issue was there were simply too many particles that needed to be visible to make the sand spreading effect  have an acceptable drain on low-performance computers
Like his incredible distaste toward building a Zhonya on mages?
